summary: @omgellendean pointed out Brienne’s leather jerkin in the first day on set video is very much like Ned’s, it’s even a similar...
body: @omgellendean pointed out Brienne’s leather jerkin in the first day on set video is very much like Ned’s, it’s even a similar colour, just the shoulders look shorter maybe, actually like Bran’s in that way (I think maybe Ned’s is laced in the opposite direction in this shot for some reason? I’ve seen others which aren’t).

reblog.comment: @omgellendean pointed out Brienne’s leather jerkin in the first day on set video is very much like Ned’s, it’s even a similar colour, just the shoulders look shorter maybe, actually like Bran’s in that way (I think maybe Ned’s is laced in the opposite direction in this shot for some reason? I’ve seen others which aren’t).

I’ve seen others which aren’t).

I’ve seen others which aren’t).

blog.name: gwidhiel
blog.title: Hardly Here
blog.description: Old, busy, Tolkien, ASoIaF & GoT fan.

title: Sansa’s and Bran’s Journeys
body:
HBO’s official GoT website, http://www.makinggameofthrones.com, has featured retrospective summaries of some of the series’ main character arcs: Arya Stark, Jon Snow, Cersei Lannister, Tyrion Lannister, and Daenerys Targaryen. These summaries of the primary fan fave characters have been available for a few months, and I’ve been waiting - so far in vain - to see the official summaries of Sansa’s and Bran’s arcs. So far, nothing, and we’re only 2 days away from the season premiere.

I find it hard to believe that’s because these two characters “aren’t important,” and so we’re not going to get summaries for their stories. I doubt that the team that runs the website simply forgot to upload them. I suspect that we’re going to see them in the next week or two, once the final season is underway, and that the reason for the delayed release is because the summaries will make it clear that Bran and Sansa - often overlooked and/or dismissed by large portions of the audience - are the unlikely heroes of the story.

summary: But think about it Bran is able to interact with the past as if he is there even though nobody can see him. He called out to his...
question: But think about it Bran is able to interact with the past as if he is there even though nobody can see him. He called out to his father at the tower of joy and Ned heard him. He warged into young Hodor linking him to present hodor dying. Bran may not have manifested into a physical form but imagine if he warged into a person to try and negotiate with the children of forest but they captured him and turned him into the night king. I also think he is responsible for the wall being built
answer:
My problem with this theory is - If Bran went back in time and skinchanged into the man who became the Night King, how is there any Bran left to go back again, to skinchange into Bran the Builder and influence him to build a Wall?

And this might just be me, but it feels a little anticlimactic for Bran to go back into the past to influence someone to build a Wall that we already see gets knocked down. It’s possible, I suppose, but we already know it’s just a temporary solution.

When it comes to Hodor, I think we’re supposed to be wildly uncomfortable with Bran skinchanging into him. It feels wrong, especially to Hodor but to the reader, too. To me, it feels wrong if Bran is supposed to invade the mind of something to save the world.

One theory I love is that Bran accidentally skinchanged into (the likewise fragile-minded) King Aerys somewhere along his time traveling journey, and that’s why the Mad King was chanting, Hodor-style, “Burn them all!”

Just like Hodor hearing Meera’s plea to “Hold the door”, Aerys might’ve heard instructions to burn wights (or maybe weirwood trees?), descending into a madness that caused his murder by Jaime Lannister - who interpreted it, instead, as an instruction to burn the citizens of King’s Landing.

If that turns out to be true, then Bran skinchanging into another person without their consent caused more harm than good a second time. Still assuming that’s what happened, then the third time resulted in the most powerful ‘monster’ Westeros has ever known.

Either way, I must admit I’m not the biggest fan of “Bran = The Night King”. I’m a bigger fan of Bran being kin to the Night King and ultimately helping him (or healing him).

My best guess is that whatever wildcard Bran might be holding will be much more “down to earth” than we expect.

title: I am betting on Bran/3ER.
body:
My theory is that Jon has it all wrong about the dragons. It’s not D/ny and the dragons who will be the decisive factor in defeating the NK. It will be Bran. 

Bran is the 3ER who can travel through space and time. Bran can warg. With each passing day, he is getting stronger. He might be in full control of his powers by the time Jon arrives in WF. We have yet to see the full extent of his powers. We will learn more about his powers in the final season. 

If Jon had stayed in WF and not gone to DS, he would have been there when Bran arrived. Jon would have found out that Bran is the 3ER and that he is the key to the defeat or neutralization of the NK. 

When Jon returns to WF, he will quickly learn that they don’t need the dragons. Jon will regret going to DS and bringing D/ny and her dragons to the North.

blog.description: "all the elements in your body were forged many, many millions of years ago in the heart of a far away star that explosed and died. that explosion scattered those elements across the desolations of deep space, until, eventually, they came together to make you. you are unique in the universe." - doctor who. marie; taurus, istj. blarke is my core, olicity trash, bitter queen. love girls on tv, pro-girls unity. atla/tlok hoe. waiting for the doctor. samwise gamgee saved middle earth. daensa is endgame, & sansa and dany are both queens ; protect the dragons (and the direwolves). sam winchester and jack kline are the softest. korra is bae. thor is the strongest avenger. mcu/dc(tv), lotr, got, spn. [ship and let ship]

summary: Yo on 6x05 tho, the Night King came with his entire army to attack Bran*. Bran is freaking important, like I don’t know how, but...
body:
Yo on 6x05 tho, the Night King came with his entire army to attack Bran*. Bran is freaking important, like I don’t know how, but he’s vital and the Night King really wants him dead.

* and by Bran I mean the Three Eyed-Raven because on 6x05 the Night King doesn’t care about Bran to begin with. He goes for the Three Eyed-Raven, and tries to kill him before he gives his “knowledge”/powers to Bran. Now that Bran is the Three Eyed-Raven, I bet the Night King wants him extra dead too.

summary:
GoT Season 8 Premiere 
*Sam and Bran find Jon as he leaves Daenerys’s chambers in Winterfell*
Sam: Good morning Jon. 
Jon: What...
body:
GoT Season 8 Premiere

*Sam and Bran find Jon as he leaves Daenerys’s chambers in Winterfell*

Sam: Good morning Jon.

Jon: What are you both doing here?

Bran: We have a surprise for you.

Jon: Well judging from the looks on your faces, I don’t want it.

Isaac Hempstead Wright (Bran Stark),
